meanings.definition: The state or quality of being extremely cold or icy.
meanings.sent1: The gelidities of the frozen lake sent shivers down my spine.
meanings.sent2: The gelidities of the snow-covered mountains were breathtaking.
meanings.sent3: Despite the gelidities of the ice cream, I couldn't resist taking another bite.
meanings.sent4: The gelidities of her stare made me feel like I was standing in a blizzard.
meanings.sent5: The gelidities of the Arctic Ocean were as sharp as icicles in winter.

meanings.definition: The ability to cause a sensation of extreme coldness.
meanings.sent1: His touch had the gelidities of an ice cube on a hot summer day.
meanings.sent2: The gelidities of the cold wind made me shiver uncontrollably.
meanings.sent3: The gelidities of the popsicle made my teeth chatter with delight.
meanings.sent4: Her words had the gelidities of an icy blast, freezing me in place.
meanings.sent5: The gelidities of the freezer aisle enveloped me as I reached for the ice cream.

meanings.definition: The act of becoming frozen or solidified.
meanings.sent1: The gelidities of the water turned it into a block of ice.
meanings.sent2: The gelidities of the chocolate hardened into a delicious treat.
meanings.sent3: The gelidities of the lava lamp froze mid-flow, creating a unique sculpture.
meanings.sent4: Time seemed to stop as the gelidities of the moment solidified around us.
meanings.sent5: The gelidities of the liquid nitrogen transformed the flower into a delicate ice sculpture.
